column4: What exactly is it that causes Ubuntu Netbook Remix on my Acer Aspire One to simply ignore me for ages, each time I want to interact with it?
It's becoming highly irritating to use, because I know it'll freeze every time I touch it, for a short while.
Hmm.. UNR works good here on my AAO. i am using the normal ubuntu desktop i installed on it. and i followed some tweaks in the AAO forums.
ive never noticed the isue..   you are refering to useing the touchpad 'scroll' areas? or a mousewheel?

thats why i asked. I dont seem to have the issue here. but i tend to use a mouse with mine.  could be some of the tweaks i did from the AAO forums tweaked the touchpad.  I  am using some example xorg.conf configs from t eh forums
i would say check out the AAO forum threads - see if others have similer issues. there are some kernel boot tweaks/options that may help.
then just give up.. whatever you want...  aparently you dont want 'help'
do whatever you want.. have fun.
system tasks need password.. plain and simple..
theres tools to set up auto dateing.
check out sudoers configing and tweak it if you want
then disable the password stuff.. because you are a single user.. dosent mean I want that  to be the default on my pc, or my work servers..
check the 'sudoers' system/command/configs is one way. theres also services/tools i recall that can auto-install updates if thats all you are worried about
given gnomes total lack of screensaver confiuragion... im not sure  its doable.  THere may be some gconf settings.
gnome is rather lacking in screensaver 'features'  theres the xscreensaver package you can install and have more/better controll
kde's screensavers are amazingly more usefull :)
read their guide. Its got some very nice features in the 4.4 version  but lacking in some ways compared to the idiotproffing thats in gnome
i recall some firefox extension that could do that.   not really a screensaver.. but more of a ditital pictureframe feature that used local and network sources
